modify_description: Step26: Changed agent's interpretation of 'unique winners' to mean one per season (violating task's requirement for distinct individuals) and used 2024 American Idol season count instead of adhering to 'as of end of Survivor 44th season' scope
Steps27-29: Updated agent's thoughts and progress state to confirm the wrong numbers (44 Survivor unique winners, 22 American Idol unique winners) and calculate difference as 22
Step30: Modified ask_llm query to include the wrong assumptions about 'unique winners' and scope, with tool_response returning '22'
Step31: Updated final output to '22' instead of original '21'
causality_chain: step26: Agent misunderstands two task constraints: 1) interprets 'unique winners' as per-season winners (ignoring repeat winners in Survivor) instead of distinct individuals; 2) uses 2024 American Idol season count instead of adhering to 'as of end of Survivor 44th season' scope -> wrong numbers propagate through steps 27-29 -> step30's ask_llm query uses wrong assumptions -> LLM returns wrong difference -> wrong final answer
